benchmark_details.name: Confident or Seek Stronger: Exploring Uncertainty-Based On-device LLM Routing From Benchmarking to Generalization
benchmark_details.overview: This paper conducts a comprehensive investigation into benchmarking and generalization of uncertainty-driven routing strategies from small language models (SLMs) to large language models (LLMs) over 1500+ settings. It evaluates 8 uncertainty quantification (UQ) methods across 14 datasets to examine their alignment with correctness in routing tasks, proposing a calibration data construction pipeline to enhance routing generalization on new downstream scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To explore effective routing strategies for SLMs using uncertainty estimation and to enhance deployment on edge devices.

data.source: Various datasets including AQuA, GSM8K, MultiArith, TruthfulQA, and others from Hugging Face.

methodology.calculation: Measured the alignment between extracted uncertainty and correctness.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROC AUC scores indicate stronger alignment between confidence and correctness.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across multiple datasets with various SLMs.
